title: Noles News : Kalen Deloach leads the  Noles one last time
body_text:
Florida State football, recruiting news: Kalen Deloach leads the ‘Noles one last time
FSU takes on the Georgia in the Orange Bowl
From Savannah to Tallahassee; Kalen Deloach is ready to lead the ‘Noles onto the field one last time.
“I told him [Brinson], when we did hang out, that we got something for him on the 30th,” Deloach said jokingly. “I do have them boys up front. I told them when you see 97, go extra hard.”
“To see kids from Savannah be on one of the biggest stages in the county, it says we do have talented athletes,” Rob Deloach, Kalen’s father and Brinson’s former trainer, said. “That’s why we need to support our youth.”
Florida State is a heavy underdog to Georgia but don’t tell that to Shyheim Brown:
Leave it to Matt Baker for a non-FSU media source to start making sense:
Honestly, what else is there to say about Mario Cristobal and game management?
I’m looking forward to seeing Trey Benson in Green Bay:
Recruiting:
FSU will be hosting two transfer targets for official visits soon:
Tennessee safety Wesley Walker and Purdue Edge Nic Scourton.
Aside from MJJ FSU’s transfer portal has been quiet so far but I don’t expect that to be the case much longer.
Other Sports:
The culture in Tallahassee is as strong as its ever been:
The National Champions continue to add talent to its loaded roster:
Alumni:
An absolutely ridiculous play by Jermaine Johnson; special:
